member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.WebCombo.ClientSideEvents.#ctor
member.summary: The default public constructor for the ClientSideEvents object. This object is created automatically by the WebCombo control.
member.remarks: This class is used to provide an container for the controls client side events.

member.summary: Returns an empty string.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebCombo.ClientSideEvents.InitializeCombo
member.summary: Returns or sets a string of text that specifies the name of the JavaScript function to be called when the Combo has been initialized and is ready for display.
member.remarks: This is the first event fired during the WebCombo's client side life cycle.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebCombo.ClientSideEvents.BeforeDropDown
member.summary: Returns or sets a string of text that specifies the name of the JavaScript function to be called prior to the dropdown portion of the control being displayed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebCombo.ClientSideEvents.AfterDropDown
member.summary: Returns or sets a string of text that specifies the name of the JavaScript function to be called immediately after the dropdown portion of the control has been displayed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebCombo.ClientSideEvents.BeforeCloseUp
member.summary: Returns or sets a string of text that specifies the name of the JavaScript function to be called prior to the dropdown portion of the control closing up.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebCombo.ClientSideEvents.AfterCloseUp
member.summary: Returns or sets a string of text that specifies the name of the JavaScript function to be called immediately after the dropdown portion of the control has been closed up.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebCombo.ClientSideEvents.AfterSelectChange
member.summary: Returns or sets a string of text that specifies the name of the JavaScript function to be called immediately after the selected row in the dropdown portion of the control has changed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebCombo.ClientSideEvents.EditKeyDown
member.summary: Returns or sets a string of text that specifies the name of the JavaScript function to be called when a key has been pressed down within the edit portion of the control.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebCombo.ClientSideEvents.EditKeyUp
member.summary: Returns or sets a string of text that specifies the name of the JavaScript function to be called when a key has been pressed down within the edit portion of the control.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebCombo.ClientSideEvents.BeforeSelectChange
member.summary: Returns or sets a string of text that specifies the name of the JavaScript function to be called prior to the selected row in the dropdown portion of the control being changed.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.WebCombo.ColumnsListEditor
member.summary: General-purpose implementation of an Editor for choosing a column name from the bound data source.

summary.para: This is an override from UITypeEditor. The property grid will call this when it wants to display the editor for the given value.
This is an override from UITypeEditor. The editor style indicates what type of editor we are providing: we can either display a dialog or a drop-down box. Our editor always shows a drop-down box.
This is an override from UITypeEditor and indicates if we support painting a small representation of our value in the property grid.

summary.p: The properties of the DropDownLayout object control the look and behavior of the drop-down area of the control. Most of these properties are reflected directly down to the WebGrid control that is created as a child control of the WebCombo.
Returns or sets a System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit value that determines how wide the dropdown will be when the user clicks the dropdown button.
Returns or sets a System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit value that determines the height of the dropdown.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebCombo.DropDownLayout.AllowColSizing
member.summary: Determines whether the user is allowed to change the width of columns in the dropdown.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebCombo.DropDownLayout.AllowRowSizing
member.summary: Specifies whether and how the user can change the height of the rows in the dropdown.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebCombo.DropDownLayout.AllowSorting
member.summary: Specifies whether the user can sort columns.
member.remarks: This property determines whether the user can sort the data in the combo based on values present in a column. The HeaderClickAction must also be set to HeaderClickAction.Sort in order for the columns to sort when the header is clicked.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebCombo.DropDownLayout.AutoGenerateColumns
member.summary: Specifies whether the combo should generate any columns automatically when data binding occurs.

remarks.p: At design-time set this property to true and all of the bound columns will be generated. At run-time, if this property is true and there are no columns that were automatically generated (all the properties are false) then all of the columns from the data source will be added to the existing columns in the grid.
You can add your own columns to the grid in addition to the columns generated by the control. By default, any columns you add appear to the left of the columns generated automatically.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebCombo.DropDownLayout.HeaderClickAction
member.summary: Specifies what action to take when column headers are clicked.
member.remarks: This property determines whether a column will be sorted or if multiple columns can be sorted. Possible values are: HeaderClickAction.NotSet - No action is taken when the header is clicked HeaderClickAction.Select - The column is selected, (Not supported for WebCombo). HeaderClickAction.SortSingle - The column is sorted, (AllowSorting must be set). HeaderClickAction.SortMulti - The column is sorted in combination with other columns when the Ctrl or Shift key is down, (AllowSorting must be set).

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebCombo.DropDownLayout.CellPadding
member.summary: The amount of cell padding to use when rendering the dropdown.
member.remarks: Cell padding is the amount of white space between the borders of the cell and the cell's contents. To specify the amount of space separating cells from one another, use .

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebCombo.DropDownLayout.CellSpacing
member.summary: The amount of cell spacing to use when rendering the grid.
member.remarks: Cell spacing is the amount of space separating cells from one another. To specify the amount of white space between the borders of the cell and the cell's contents, use .

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebCombo.DropDownLayout.ColFootersVisible
member.summary: Determines whether to show column footers for the dropdown.

remarks.p: Column footers can be enabled for the dropdown, providing a convenient way to display column-related information. For example, you can display the total of a column of figures, or the number of items checked in a checkbox column.
When you enable column footers, the footers will appear, but you must still specify what information they will contain. You can do this through the property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebCombo.DropDownLayout.ColHeadersVisible
member.summary: Determines whether to show column headers in the dropdown.

remarks.p: Column headers can be enabled for the dropdown, providing labeling and additional functionality for coulmns. A column header typically contains the formatted name of the field to which the comlumn is bound.
Column headers may be formatted through the , and properties of the UltraGridColumn object.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebCombo.DropDownLayout.ColWidthDefault
member.summary: The default width of columns in the dropdown, in Units.

remarks.p: The default value for this property is 100 (pixels).

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebCombo.DropDownLayout.FooterStyle
member.summary: The default style that will be applied to column footers.

remarks.p: This property specifies a default style that will be applied to all the column footers. The style may be overridden by the individual object.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebCombo.DropDownLayout.FrameStyle
member.summary: An object that contains the style properties for the control's frame.

remarks.p: Use this property to provide a custom style for the frame of the dropdown. Common style attributes that can be adjusted include: forecolor, backcolor, font, and alignment. You can use different styles to provide a consistent look throughout your application, enhance the appearance of certain areas of the grid, or to call attention to important data.
Some properties of this style are used as base properties for all other styles. They include: background color, font, foreground color, cursor, horizontal and vertical alignment, and word wrap.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebCombo.DropDownLayout.GridLines
member.summary: Specifies which cell borders should be shown. The default is UltraGridLines.Both.
member.remarks: Use this property to quickly format the display of the lines separating the cells in the dropdown. You can choose to show horizontal lines, vertical lines, both or neither. Note: In order for the grid lines to appear at all, it is necessary to have the Border Style, Color and/or Width set in the RowStyleDefault property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebCombo.DropDownLayout.HeaderStyle
member.summary: The default style that will be applied to headers. This is the default value that may be overridden by individual columns.

remarks.p: This property specifies a default style that will be applied to all column headers in the dropdown. The style may be overridden by the individual object.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebCombo.DropDownLayout.ImageUrls
member.summary: Object holder for images used in the dropdown. Use the properties of this object to customize the various images that are displayed within the dropdown area of WebCombo.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebCombo.DropDownLayout.JavaScriptFileName
member.summary: The base name and path for the JavaScript files that are used for client side behavior. The root name of the file, (ig_WebGrid) is used as the base for determining the other files that are contain related functionality. If this root file name is changed, then all other file names must be changed as well.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebCombo.DropDownLayout.RowAlternateStyle
member.summary: The default style that will be appplied to alternate (even numbered) rows in the dropdown.

remarks.p: This property specifies a style that will be applied to alternate rows.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebCombo.DropDownLayout.RowHeightDefault
member.summary: The default height that will be appplied to all rows in the dropdown.

remarks.p: This property specifies a default height that will be applied to all rows. The style may be overridden by the band or by the individual object.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebCombo.DropDownLayout.RowSelectors
member.summary: Specifies whether row selectors will be displayed in the dropdown.

remarks.p: This property specifies the default visibility for row selectors. The default is RowSelectors.Yes

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebCombo.DropDownLayout.RowSelectorStyle
member.summary: The default style that will be applied to row selectors in the dropdown.

remarks.p: This property specifies a default style that will be applied to all the row selectors.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebCombo.DropDownLayout.RowSizing
member.summary: Specifies whether and how the user can change the height of the rows in the dropdown. The default is AllowSizing.Fixed.

remarks.p: The RowSizing property specifies whether the user can resize rows using the mouse in the dropdown.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebCombo.DropDownLayout.RowStyle
member.summary: The default style that will be applied to rows.

remarks.p: This property specifies a default style that will be applied to all the rows. The style may be overridden by the individual object.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebCombo.DropDownLayout.SelectedRowStyle
member.summary: The style that will be applied to the selected row in the dropdown.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebCombo.DropDownLayout.TableLayout
member.summary: The type of table layout in effect for the dropdown. If this value is set to Auto, the heights and widths of rows and columns are interpreted by the browser as a recommendation. The Browser will still make adjustments as needed to make as much information as possible visible. If this property value is set to Fixed, the Browser will treat row and column heights and widths literally and force them to the indicated values. This option is only effective on up-level browsers.

summary.p: This object encapsulates the Internet Explorer Transitions functionality that WebCombo exposes.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.WebCombo.ExpandEffects.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representation of the ExpandEffects object.

remarks.p: Some objects do not have values that can be converted to a string. In these cases, an empty string is returned.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebCombo.ExpandEffects.Duration
member.summary: Specifies the amount of time elapsed in milliseconds between the beginning and the end of a transition effect.

remarks.p: This is the amount of time it takes the expand effect to occur. If is set to ExpandEffectsType.Notset, this setting has no effect.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebCombo.ExpandEffects.Opacity
member.summary: Specifies the amount of transparency applied to the expandable object after the expand effect is complete.

remarks.p: This property specifies the opacity of the expandable object as a percentage. A setting of 100 is completely opaque, a setting of 0 is completely transparent (invisible). A setting in between these values will produce a partially visisble expandable object through which the background may be seen.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebCombo.ExpandEffects.ShadowColor
member.summary: Specifies the color of the drop shadow that will appear under the expandable object.

remarks.p: Drop shadows provide an illusion of depth to expandable objects as they appear over the web page. You can specify the width of the drop shadow using the property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebCombo.ExpandEffects.ShadowWidth
member.summary: Specifies the width of the drop shadow that will appear under the expandable object.

remarks.p: Drop shadows provide an illusion of depth to expandable objects as they appear over the web page. Set this property to 0 to eliminate the drop shadow. You can specify the color of the drop shadow using the property.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.WebCombo.LocalizedCategoryAttribute.GetLocalizedString(System.String)

member.param: Name of the category to retreive

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebCombo.UltraLicenseAttribute.LicensedWithProducts
member.summary: Return the list of products that this control can be licensed with

summary.p: The WebCombo control is a multi-column, editable drop-down selection control. It allows users to choose values from a detailed list of items that is shown when the arrow in the control is clicked.

The drop-down area of WebCombo is based on the WebGrid control and supports many of the same features. Column and row sizing, sorting and row selectors are all supported within the drop-down. Because the WebCombo is intended for the selection of data values, editing within the drop-sown is not supported.
If a filed can contain values beyond those in the list, the WebCombo can be set to editable so that values can be typed directly into the control.
The WebCombo can be used a stand-alone control anywhere on a web page that you would use a combobox control. WebCombo can also be used from within WebGrid to display ValueLists inside of grid cells.

remarks.p: This method should not be used.

summary.p: Raises the NodeChanged event.

remarks.p: Invoke this method to programmatically generate the NodeChanged event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
This method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
When overriding NodeChanged in a derived class, be sure to call the base class' OnNodeChanged method so that registered delegates receive the event.

param.name: row
param.p: A reference to the Row object that was changed.

member.summary: Determine the correct rendering class to instantiate and do it

summary.p: Returns a reference to or sets the currently selected Row object.

remarks.p: The selected row is rendered using the CSS class specified by the SelectedRowStyle property.
When a row is selected, either by user interaction or programmatically, the SelectedRowChanged event is generated.
If no row is selected, this property returns Nothing or Null.

summary.p: Returns or sets the index of the currently selected Row in the drop-down.

remarks.p: The selected is rendered using the CSS class specified by the SelectedRowStyle property.
When a row is selected, either by user interaction, or programmatically, the SelectedRowChanged event is generated.
If no row is selected, this property returns Nothing or Null.

summary.p: Returns a reference to the currently selected Cell object.
The selected cell is determined by a combination of which row is currently selected, and which column within the row has been designated as the data column.

The data column is designated by setting either the DataTextField property or the first cell in the row. The properties are examined in the order specified (Text then the first cell) to make the determination of which cell within the row is the Selected Cell.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebCombo.WebCombo.ComboTypeAhead
member.summary: Determines what typeahead behavior the control will abide by
member.remarks: Used to provide the user with differing levels of type ahead ability

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebCombo.WebCombo.Editable
member.summary: Determines if the WebCombo control allows values to be entered by the user.

remarks.p: You can choose to provide the user with the ability to enter their own values in the text portion of the WebCombo. You do this by setting the Editable property to True.

summary.p: Returns or sets a boolean value that determines whether or not the HTML is rendered in a compact format that is less readable but which optimizes page download time.
When this property is set to true, extra spaces, tabs and line feed characters are not used in the rendered html.

member.summary: Specifies the column name from the dropdown that will be used to display the text content of the top portion of the WebCombo.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebCombo.WebCombo.DataValueField
member.summary: Specifies the column name from the dropdown that will be used as the source for the DataValue of the WebCombo control.

summary.p: Returns or sets a boolean value that determines whether or not Select dropdown controls will be automatically hidden when submenus are being displayed.
When this property is set to true, all select controls in the page document are hidden until the popup menus are dismissed.

remarks.p: This functionality is necessary due to the problematic way that Internet Explorer implements the Select DropDown control. Netscape 6+ handles this situation properly and the hiding of dropdowns is not necessary.
